meanings.definition: The opening from the stomach into the duodenum.
meanings.sent1: Food passes through the pylorus to enter the small intestine.
meanings.sent2: Doctors observed the pylorus to understand the digestive process better.
meanings.sent3: The pylorus decided to take a break and let the food stay in the stomach a bit longer.
meanings.sent4: Her determination was like a tightly closed pylorus, not allowing any distractions.
meanings.sent5: The pylorus, like a gatekeeper, controlled the flow of food into the duodenum.

meanings.definition: The valve at the lower end of the stomach.
meanings.sent1: The pylorus regulates the passage of food from the stomach to the small intestine.
meanings.sent2: The doctor examined the pylorus to check for any abnormalities.
meanings.sent3: The pylorus joked with the other stomach parts about being the gatekeeper of digestion.
meanings.sent4: Her heart felt like a tight pylorus, protecting her emotions from spilling out.
meanings.sent5: The pylorus, like a guardian, ensured only properly digested food passed through.
